title: The Writer's Almanac - Tuesday, January 12, 2021
description: It’s the birthday of James Winthrop (1588), who called the new world a “City on the Hill” but also emphasized that “the rich had a holy duty to look after the poor.”
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: It’s the birthday of James Winthrop (1588), who called the new world a “City on the Hill” but also emphasized that “the rich had a holy duty to look after the poor.”
